result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota J Kafer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $150.00 per month commencing 6/01/2015; (w/payment plan fee of $15.00) alternate 22 days jail consecutive.
DNA surcharge to be paid with fine on payment plan.
Perform 30 hours community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offse the fine and costs, to be completed in 9 months. Alternate 20 days jail consecutive.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dated May 12, 2015 filed by Attorney Huppertz with attached letter verifying community service hours and requesting the judgmet of conviction be amended to reflect the credit.
30 hours Community Service to help offset the fine and costs; alternate 20 days Jail.  30 hours ($300.00) St. Vincent de Paul, Waukesha.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dakota J Kafer in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- Fine totaling $893.00 to be paid at a rate of $150.00 per month commencing 06/01/2015; alternate 22 days jail consecutive                
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - append to fine
- Court orders Defendant to perform 30 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the fine and costs and to be completed in 9 months; alternate 20 days jail - consecutive

Per Attorney Huppertz's office. 
ADDRESS INFO for Dakota J Kafer
Current: 1157 W Sunset Drive, c/o Jim Rossetti, Waukesha, WI 53189 United States  (Effective: 03-19-2015)
Prior: C/o Waukesha County Jail  515 W. Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188

Attorney Mark Powers for attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Dakota J Kafer did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a date in 45 days. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences.

Defendant Dakota J Kafer in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew Huppertz.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
